alert.note: Alert for Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 8:53PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Bonner and north central Kootenai Counties through 900 PM PDT... At 752 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Dover, or 10 miles southwest of Sandpoint, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Athol, Cocolalla, Bayview, Careywood and Granite. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 449 and 470. U.S. Highway 2 in Idaho between mile markers 12 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
